replies.bodyText: I am curious about that as well :-D
replies.author: jbartece

replies.bodyText: no idea, when does intellij add these annotations?
replies.author: dominikbrazdil

timeline.bodyHTML:
I think it should be like this?

Suggested change
assertThat(!params.getParameters().isEmpty());
assertThat(!params.getBuildType().isEmpty());
assertThat(params.getParameters()).isNotEmpty();
assertThat(params.getBuildType()).isNotEmpty();
timeline.author: janinko

replies.bodyText: I can't find anything similar to String.isNotEmpty(), hamcrest supports something like this assertThat(string, is(not(emptyString()))) but that does not seem any better to me
replies.author: dominikbrazdil

replies.bodyText:
You must call it on the object returned by assertThat not String.
E.g.: assertThat("test").isNotEmpty();
replies.author: jbartece
